intro: Myosotis frigida, commonly known as the alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Myosotis frigida has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in high-altitude habitats. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
